comment: Add 1 to all but the top entry in the left column of the Pascal matrix. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 18 2013
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A103451(n,k) * A007318(n,k), an infinite lower triangular matrix.
T(n,k) = binomial(n, k) with T(n, 0) = 2 for n>0.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= If[k==n, 1, If[k==0, 2, Binomial[n, k]]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021 *)
program: def A132749(n,k): return 1 if k==n else 2 if k==0 else binomial(n,k)
flatten([[A132749(n,k) for k in [0..n]] for n in [0..12]]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 16 2021
A132749:= func< n,k | k eq n select 1 else k eq 0 select 2 else Binomial(n,k) >;
